latex:
The letters $ A$, $ B$, $ C$ and $ D$ represent digits. If $ \begin{tabular}{ccc} &A&B \\ +&C&A \\ \hline &D&A \end{tabular}$ and $ \begin{tabular}{ccc} &A&B \\ -&C&A \\ \hline &&A \end{tabular}$, what digit does $ D$ represent?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 5 \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ 6 \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ 7 \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 8 \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 9$
